page.title: 14GRASSLAND ON ARNE PENINSULA
page.content: The area of improved pasture forms a very small amount of the surveyed area which is farmed.It is sown with a commercial mixture of rye grass and other species,improved by the application of fertilizer and used for the production of silage and for winter grazing,but the Arne Farm is a small one of 100 acres and land use for agriculture is not intensive. Examination of this improved grassland shows at once how the species diversity decreases and the typical calcifuge vegetation of heathers seen on the acid heaths is destroyed.However the destruction of large areas of lowland heath in Dorset in the last century is due to urbanisation and open cast mining for sand and gravel rather than the encroachment of agriculture.
